lexUnit.name: crouch.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: adopt a position where the knees are bent and the upper body is brought forward and down.

sentence.text: In the chair crouched the figure of Vanessa Dersingham , stitching a tapestry .
Around the campfire crouched three red-bearded highlanders , clad in considerable quantities of musty-looking tartan and armed to the yellow teeth .
Beside me crouched the provost , looking concerned .
I was crouching just feet away , terrified that at any moment one of the massive males would charge into me in the desperate struggle .
Invisible goblin presences crouched all over the green she had to cross and the tower of St Leonard 's , shadowed in clouded moonlight , waited like a hungry creature whose lair she had to pass .
It was a bad moment as she crouched there , looking at him .
He crouched there a moment , watching him .
" Sorry , " I said , still crouching against the wall .
He crouched at the French doors , waiting for John to arrive ; then followed him around like a puppy .
They continued their walk , rousing the surly porter from where he crouched at the edge of the track , chewing a piece of fresh grass .
RAF Corporal John Williams and his wife Selina told the court they were driving past the layby and saw men were crouching behind two wooden boards , which made a v-shape on the ground .
The Palestinian gunmen crouching behind the sand embankment across Boulevard Ariss went on watching the Syrian tanks , ignoring the sound .
The Prime Minister crouched behind his spectacles , while spread out on both wings of the platform sat the members of his Cabinet .
One day we were crouching by the gardener 's bonfire ( his pride was that the fire smouldered day and night and never went out ) .
Michele was crouching by her side , his face taut .
As Taff and I crouched in our trenches eating our afternoon meal and trying very hard to ignore the clouds of mosquitoes that were buzzing all around us , I looked at Taff .
` This is difficult , very difficult , " said one Bosnian soldier as he crouched in a trench about to sprint across open ground under the sights of Serb gunners .
A rifleman hit two men crouching near the Colonel , who later wrote that ` this was the first time in warfare that I truly felt fear .
She was crouching near the dying fire , hands around the cup for warmth , when she heard a scratching sound at the door .
She had thought of so many ways of greeting Brett ; now all she could do was to crouch on her knees by his bed and hold her face level with his while tears poured from her eyes .
At the foot of the turf cliff , Hazel and his companions were crouching under the low branches of two or three spindle-trees .
Pleydell and his small group of medical orderlies carried out a number of quite complicated operations whilst crouching under bushes and being machine-gunned from the air .
It was also very cramped -- more of a coal hole than a cellar -- and there was only just room for both of them to crouch under the trap door and wait .
Ann , made of sterner stuff than I , refused all invitations to have the first cast and eventually , crouching below the skyline , I reached the appointed place .
For an hour the three of us crouched inside the leaking tent .
He pulled a handful of gold and silver chains from his sporran , tossing them beside her where she crouched .
